messages.title: Labour’s vow on shipyard jobs
messages.content: Labour started the Trident successor programme and the next Labour government will finish it. That's a non-negotiable guarantee. While Tories from the area spread lies about our yard's future, as your MP I will always give my all to stand up for you and our town.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour commits to finishing the Trident successor programme, describing it as a non-negotiable guarantee and a means to securing shipyard jobs and boosting the economy.
The campaign emphasizes the protection of hospital maternity services, suggesting efforts to maintain or enhance NHS provisions in this area.

issues.economy: Labour's commitment to the Trident program is linked to securing shipyard jobs and boosting the local economy.
issues.health: The imagery and slogans suggest a focus on protecting NHS services, particularly hospital maternity services.

leaflet.personalStatement: As your MP I will always give my all to stand up for you and our town.

endorsements.endorser: Shadow defence secretary Vernon Coaker MP at BAE Systems in Barrow

quotes.text: Labour started the Trident successor programme and the next Labour government will finish it. That's a non-negotiable guarantee.

images.caption: John Woodcock smiling with the text 'Labour’s vow on shipyard jobs'
A group of people, including children, with the text 'NHS - Maternity Our hospital...SAVE OUR HOSPITAL...our jobs'

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet emphasizes Labour's commitment to job security in shipyards through the Trident program and protecting NHS services, with a specific focus on hospital maternity services.
